title: National Agriculture Day, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump designating March 18, 2025, as National Agriculture Day. It emphasizes the historical significance of farmers and agricultural communities in the United States, recognizing their vital role in the economy and culture. The proclamation highlights that over 95% of U.S. farms are family-owned and crucial for rural stability, contributing to 83% of total farm production.

The President commits to strengthening American agriculture by addressing challenges such as the spread of bird flu, promoting fair trade practices, and enhancing market access for farmers. He expresses gratitude to farmers and agricultural workers for their hard work and self-reliance, underscoring their role in nourishing the nation and supporting its way of life.

The proclamation encourages all Americans to acknowledge agriculture's importance in daily life and to appreciate those in the agricultural sector. Overall, it serves to reaffirm the administration's support for the agricultural community and its contributions to American prosperity.
